page.title: Wowza Support Ticket 답변
page.content: ## In replies all text above this line is added to the ticket ##    Your request (233395) has been updated.    You can add a comment by replying to this email.                               Alex Chepurnoy (Wowza Media Systems, LLC)      Jun 8, 9:43 PM CDT      Hello Pak,            Thank you for contacting Wowza support.            Before we get going, I do want to let you know that we keep one ticket open per one issue, this is to make sure that each issue gets full attention.      I will be responding to all 3 quiestions in this ticket, but if you need to follow up on question 2 or 3, please open a new support ticket.            1. Regarding latency:      In order to achieve lowest possible latency for RTSP and/or RTMP, you should follow the instructions described here:            https://www.wowza.com/docs/how-to-set-up-low-latency-applications-in-wowza-streaming-engine-for-rtmp-streaming            The HTTP based streaming protocols like MPEG-DASH and Apple HLS are not suitable for low latency streaming because of the nature of these streaming protocols. These are chunk based protocols, which by definition cannot be low latency. Normally, a player will need to download several http chunks (usually 3) before it can begin to play back a live stream. The latency is greatly influenced on how long each chunk is. By default, Wowza Streaming Engine is creating 10 second chunks, which would induce a minimum of 30s live latency. It is possible to control the duration of the chunks created by following the instructions described in these forum articles:            https://www.wowza.com/docs/how-to-configure-apple-hls-packetization-cupertinostreaming            https://www.wowza.com/docs/how-to-configure-mpeg-dash-packetization-mpegdashstreaming            Please note that a very short media chunk (1s) can induce other playback issues. For example, it a player needs more than 1s to download a 1s chunk, it will stop the playback because it needs to wait for the chunk to be downloaded before it can play it back.                  2. Wowza Player is designed to play back only HLS streams. To learn more about playing back HDS streams please check this article: https://www.wowza.com/docs/how-to-playback-with-the-example-adobe-flash-players-san-jose-adobe-hds            3. You can register for support here: http://info.wowza.com/clouddeploymentsupport      Once this is done, you will get a key that you can use in our support portal: https://www.wowza.com/portal/account      The location of the license key is [wowza install directory]/conf/Server.license            Regards,      Alex Chepurnoy      Wowza Support Engineer            Please note that my office hours are:      Thursday - Monday from 2:00am - 11:00am UTC / 6pm (previous day) - 3am PST.                                                      Pak Taesung      Jun 8, 1:55 AM CDT      Good day.      I’m Korean and I’m now using AWS EC2 & CloudFormation with Live Streaming in Wowza Streaming Engine.      AWS Region is ‘Asia(Tokyo)’.      I paid 'Wowza Streaming Engine 4: Pro Edition (HVM)' license at Amazon Markeplace. (url -      https://aws.amazon.com/marketplace/pp/B012BW3WB8?qid=1496901922817&sr=0-1&ref_=srh_res_product_title)       So I created EC2 m3.large instance and now testing if it is working well.      My goal is to play multiple live streams in web page using node.js or Javascript. Live Encoding is on Android Tablet or Android Phone with GoCoder App.      I have 3 questions.      1. How can I manage or reduce Latency time?       : I tried 2 cases - EC2 directly , using CloudFormation      : I connected just two encoding devices(iPhone, Android Phone) to my EC2 wowza instance, sometimes It takes about 25 seconds or sometimes takes 3 seconds. but I want to get 3 seconds of latency time.      2. How can I allow My RMTP or HDS Live Streaming to web page using 'wowzaplayer.min.js'?      : I saw one document "How to get started with Wowza Player"      (https://www.wowza.com/docs/Getting-Started-with-Wowza-Player) and It saids " Wowza™ Player, a lightweight HTML5 player that plays Apple HLS streams in any browser, on any device." in very front. It worked on Safari but It failed on Chrome.      3. Where can I find my full license key?￼: because I paid for wowza license in Amazon Marketplace, I think I don’t have any info about my license key instructions.      Plz let me know the answer to my questions ASAP…       I tried lot attempts but I can’t find nice examples or contents that I want to know.      * Environments *      Wowza Streaming Engine url : http://54.65.100.1:8088/enginemanager/      ID : wowza      PW : i-0dde57512bfc4a19f      ** I attached my html file that I attempted to see if my live streaming is on web browser especially on Chrome.. **      Area: Server Performance      Attachment(s)      wowzaplayer.html                   This email is a service from Wowza Media Systems, LLC. Delivered by Zendesk        From <https://mail.daum.net/#INBOX/C000000000FUj5J>
page.html:
## In replies all text above this line is added to the ticket ##

Your request (233395) has been updated.

You can add a comment by replying to this email.


Alex Chepurnoy (Wowza Media Systems, LLC)

Jun 8, 9:43 PM CDT

Hello Pak,


Thank you for contacting Wowza support.


Before we get going, I do want to let you know that we keep one ticket open per one issue, this is to make sure that each issue gets full attention.

I will be responding to all 3 quiestions in this ticket, but if you need to follow up on question 2 or 3, please open a new support ticket.


1. Regarding latency:

In order to achieve lowest possible latency for RTSP and/or RTMP, you should follow the instructions described here:


https://www.wowza.com/docs/how-to-set-up-low-latency-applications-in-wowza-streaming-engine-for-rtmp-streaming


The HTTP based streaming protocols like MPEG-DASH and Apple HLS are not suitable for low latency streaming because of the nature of these streaming protocols. These are chunk based protocols, which by definition cannot be low latency. Normally, a player will need to download several http chunks (usually 3) before it can begin to play back a live stream. The latency is greatly influenced on how long each chunk is. By default, Wowza Streaming Engine is creating 10 second chunks, which would induce a minimum of 30s live latency. It is possible to control the duration of the chunks created by following the instructions described in these forum articles:


https://www.wowza.com/docs/how-to-configure-apple-hls-packetization-cupertinostreaming


https://www.wowza.com/docs/how-to-configure-mpeg-dash-packetization-mpegdashstreaming


Please note that a very short media chunk (1s) can induce other playback issues. For example, it a player needs more than 1s to download a 1s chunk, it will stop the playback because it needs to wait for the chunk to be downloaded before it can play it back.



2. Wowza Player is designed to play back only HLS streams. To learn more about playing back HDS streams please check this article: https://www.wowza.com/docs/how-to-playback-with-the-example-adobe-flash-players-san-jose-adobe-hds


3. You can register for support here: http://info.wowza.com/clouddeploymentsupport

Once this is done, you will get a key that you can use in our support portal: https://www.wowza.com/portal/account

The location of the license key is [wowza install directory]/conf/Server.license


Regards,

Alex Chepurnoy

Wowza Support Engineer


Please note that my office hours are:

Thursday - Monday from 2:00am - 11:00am UTC / 6pm (previous day) - 3am PST.



Pak Taesung

Jun 8, 1:55 AM CDT

Good day.

I’m Korean and I’m now using AWS EC2 & CloudFormation with Live Streaming in Wowza Streaming Engine.

AWS Region is ‘Asia(Tokyo)’.

I paid 'Wowza Streaming Engine 4: Pro Edition (HVM)' license at Amazon Markeplace. (url -

https://aws.amazon.com/marketplace/pp/B012BW3WB8?qid=1496901922817&sr=0-1&ref_=srh_res_product_title) 

So I created EC2 m3.large instance and now testing if it is working well.

My goal is to play multiple live streams in web page using node.js or Javascript. Live Encoding is on Android Tablet or Android Phone with GoCoder App.

I have 3 questions.

1. How can I manage or reduce Latency time? 

: I tried 2 cases - EC2 directly , using CloudFormation

: I connected just two encoding devices(iPhone, Android Phone) to my EC2 wowza instance, sometimes It takes about 25 seconds or sometimes takes 3 seconds. but I want to get 3 seconds of latency time.

2. How can I allow My RMTP or HDS Live Streaming to web page using 'wowzaplayer.min.js'?

: I saw one document "How to get started with Wowza Player"

(https://www.wowza.com/docs/Getting-Started-with-Wowza-Player) and It saids " Wowza™ Player, a lightweight HTML5 player that plays Apple HLS streams in any browser, on any device." in very front. It worked on Safari but It failed on Chrome.

3. Where can I find my full license key?￼: because I paid for wowza license in Amazon Marketplace, I think I don’t have any info about my license key instructions.

Plz let me know the answer to my questions ASAP… 

I tried lot attempts but I can’t find nice examples or contents that I want to know.

* Environments *

Wowza Streaming Engine url : http://54.65.100.1:8088/enginemanager/

ID : wowza

PW : i-0dde57512bfc4a19f

** I attached my html file that I attempted to see if my live streaming is on web browser especially on Chrome.. **

Area: Server Performance

Attachment(s)

wowzaplayer.html
